title: Adhere to ASCI self-regulatory content standards
description: Advertisements must be legal, decent, honest, truthful and not misleading as per ASCI code.
reference: ASCI Code of Self-Regulation in Advertising

title: Must not obstruct traffic signs or signals
description: Billboards should not block or confuse traffic signs/lights as required by IOAA guidelines.
reference: Outdoor signs shall not obstruct vehicular or pedestrian traffic or traffic signals/signs

title: Maintain minimum distance between billboards
description: The distance between following billboards must be at least 70 meters to avoid visual clutter.
reference: Minimum distance criterion reduced from 100m to 70m

title: No plastic banners under 100 microns thickness
description: Flex boards or plastic banners below 100 microns thickness are prohibited under environmental rules.

title: Require permit / NOC from municipal authorities
description: Billboards must have valid permits or NOC from the local municipal corporation.
reference: Permission required from Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai

title: Ensure structural safety per building codes
description: Billboard structures must conform to local building and structural codes with safety clearance.
reference: Signs shall be structurally designed to conform to standards

title: Lighting restrictions at night
description: Illuminated billboards must be switched off between 12 AM and 6 AM to prevent light pollution and disturbance.

title: No flashing or strobe lighting in digital billboards
description: Digital billboards must not use strobe or flashing lights that can distract drivers.
reference: NHAI Road Safety Norms for Digital Signage

title: Highway proximity restrictions
description: Billboards along highways must be at least 100 meters away from road intersections, flyovers, or curves.
reference: Prohibition near intersections for road safety

title: Ban on hoardings in heritage zones
description: Billboards must not be placed within 200 meters of heritage buildings, monuments, or protected sites.
reference: Ancient Monuments and Archaeological Sites and Remains Act, 1958

title: Pedestrian pathway safety
description: No billboards or hoardings should block footpaths, pedestrian crossings, or emergency exits.

title: Height restrictions
description: Billboards must not exceed 40 feet in height to avoid structural risks and urban skyline disruption.

title: Ban on rooftop billboards without clearance
description: Rooftop billboards require special approval to ensure no risk to building integrity or public safety.

title: Environmental responsibility
description: Billboards must use recyclable and eco-friendly materials wherever possible.

title: Content restrictions for public decency
description: Billboards must not display obscene, offensive, or politically misleading content.
